title: Acting Shakespeare
xlist: Same As: ENGL 211, section 01
yc_attrs: This course can be applied towards the Humanities and Arts Yale College distributional requirement.
description:
A practicum in acting verse drama, focusing on tools to mine the printed text for given circumstances, character, objective, and action; noting the opportunities and limitations that the printed play script presents; and promoting both the expressive freedom and responsibility of the actor as an interpretive and collaborative artist in rehearsal. The course will include work on sonnets, monologues, and scenes.

Admission by audition. Preference to seniors and juniors; open to nonmajors.
regnotes: Admission by audition. Auditions will be held on Thursday, August 30th, 6:30-10:20pm in 220 York St., Rm 101 (the “Ballroom”). Contact instructor for more information. Preference to seniors and juniors; open to nonmajors. Prospective students should prepare in advance (i.e., memorize) and will present in class (acted), one monologue or soliloquy of 15-30 lines in length, from any play by Shakespeare. Students may be asked to make adjustments and continue work on this piece. Admitted students will be informed within 24 hours and asked to confirm their acceptance, so that students on the waitlist may be released or admitted to the class. This class will also cover a brief overview of paraphrasing and scansion. Students may arrive up to 2 hours late or leave up to 2 hours early to accommodate shopping period.
rp_attr: This course meets during the Reading Period: the week between the last week of classes and finals week. Meets Reading Period
